sen.j: 公爵（こうしゃく）とは爵位（五爵）の第1位である。
sen.e: A duke or prince is the first of five peerage ranks.
A Duke or Prince is the highest of the five peerage ranks.
A Duke or Prince is the highest of the five peerage ranks.

sen.j: 侯爵の上位に相当する。
sen.e: It ranks above a marquis.
It ranks above a marquis.
It ranks above a marquis.

sen.j: 古代中国の諸侯や近代日本の華族の称号として用いられた。
sen.e: It was used as a title for lords in ancient China and the peerage in Japan after the Meiji period.
It was used as a title for Lords in ancient China and for the peerage in Japan after the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: lords は Lords としました。
sen.e: It was used as a title for Lords in ancient China and for the peerage in Japan after the Meiji period.

sen.j: ヨーロッパ・ロシアの貴族の称号であるduke（英語の場合、古代ローマの将軍・ドゥクスが語源とされる）やprince（英語での王族の男子の場合）の訳としても用いられる。
sen.e: A duke (in English that is said to be derived from dux or Roman General) or a prince (that applies for a son of the royal family) is equivalent to a title for nobles in Europe and Russia.
sen.cmt: 次の部分と続いて1文だと考えられますので結合しました。
sen.e: A Duke, which in English is said to be derived from the Latin word dux meaning a Roman General, or a Prince, the son of a member of the Royal Family, are equivalent titles for nobles in Europe and Russia.
sen.cmt: duke は Duke としました。（英語の場合…）や（英語での…）は括弧が不要と判断し削除しました。 理解を助けるため、dux にLatin word の表記を補足しました。 or Roman General は誤訳のため、meaning a Roman General と訂正しました。 is equivalent to a title を are equivalent titles for としました。
sen.e: A Duke, which in English is said to be derived from the Latin word dux meaning a Roman General, or a Prince, the son of a member of the Royal Family, are equivalent titles for nobles in Europe and Russia.

sen.j: 日本の華族制度では、世襲制であった。
sen.e: The Japanese peerage system was hereditary.
The Japanese peerage system was hereditary.
The Japanese peerage system was hereditary.

sen.j: なお、日本の「公爵」の公式英訳にはdukeではなくprinceが当てられるがこのため昭和期の政治家の近衛文麿が欧米圏の文献で皇族と誤解されるような場合がある。
sen.e: Since a Japanese word 'Koshaku' is formally translated to prince rather than duke, Fumimaro KONOE, a statesman in Showa Period, is sometimes mistakenly considered an Imperial family member in Western documents.

Since the Japanese word 'Koshaku' is formally translated as Prince rather than Duke, Fumimaro KONOE, a statesman in the Showa Period, is sometimes mistakenly considered to be a member of the Imperial Family in Western documents.
sen.cmt: a Japanese を the Japanese に、translated to prince を translated as Prince に、Showa Period を the Showa Period に、considered an Imperial family を considered to be a member of the Imperia Family に訂正しました。
sen.e: Since the Japanese word 'Koshaku' is formally translated as Prince rather than Duke, Fumimaro KONOE, a statesman in the Showa Period, is sometimes mistakenly considered to be a member of the Imperial Family in Western documents.

sen.j: 日本では明治維新後の明治17年（1884年）に宮内省達華族令が制定され、第二条において華族を公侯伯子男の五等爵とされ、公爵は第1位とされた。
sen.e: In Japan the Peerage Law was enacted by the Imperial Household Ministry in 1884 after Meiji Restoration, and Article 2 stipulated that the Kazoku (peerage) was divided into Gotoshaku or five ranks including duke, marquis, count, viscount and baron, under which a duke ranked first.

In Japan the Peerage Law was enacted by the Imperial Household Ministry in 1884 after the Meiji Restoration, and Article 2 stipulated that the Kazoku (peerage) was divided into Gotoshaku or five ranks including Duke, Marquis, Count, Viscount and Baron, under which, a Duke ranked first.
sen.cmt: Meiji Restoratio を the Meiji Restoration としました。また、duke、 marquis、 count、 viscount、 baron の頭文字は全て大文字としました。under whichの直後にコンマを付けました。
sen.e: In Japan the Peerage Law was enacted by the Imperial Household Ministry in 1884 after the Meiji Restoration, and Article 2 stipulated that the Kazoku (peerage) was divided into Gotoshaku or five ranks including Duke, Marquis, Count, Viscount and Baron, under which, a Duke ranked first.

sen.j: 明治22年（1889年）、勅令第11号貴族院令が制定されると、公爵は同令第1条の1により、公爵たる者は貴族院議員となる資格を与えられることが規定された。
sen.e: In 1889, when Imperial Edict No.11, Kizokuin (the House of Peers) Law was established, Article 1-1 of the edict entitled a duke to be a member of the House of Peers.
In 1889, when Imperial Edict No.11, Kizokuin (the House of Peers) Law was established, Article 1-1 of the edict entitled Dukes to be members of the House of Peers.
sen.cmt: a duke to be a member of the House of Peers を Dukes to be members of the House of Peers としました。
sen.e: In 1889, when Imperial Edict No.11, Kizokuin (the House of Peers) Law was established, Article 1-1 of the edict entitled Dukes to be members of the House of Peers.

sen.j: 明治40年（1907年）、皇室令第2号華族令が制定され、襲爵、華族の品位その他、手続きが細かく規定された。
sen.e: In 1907, Koshitsu-rei (the Imperial Families' Act) No.2, the Peerage Law was enacted and precisely defined the inheritance and dignity of peerage and other procedures.
In 1907, Koshitsu-rei (the Imperial Families' Act) No.2, the Peerage Law was enacted and precisely defined the inheritance and dignity of peerage and other procedures.
In 1907, Koshitsu-rei (the Imperial Families' Act) No.2, the Peerage Law was enacted and precisely defined the inheritance and dignity of peerage and other procedures.

sen.j: 公爵は以下の基準（「叙爵内規」）によって授けられた。
sen.e: The title of duke was granted according to the following standard ('Joshaku' or conferring a peerage).
The title of duke was granted according to the following standard ('Joshaku' or conferring a peerage).
The title of duke was granted according to the following standard ('Joshaku' or conferring a peerage).

sen.j: 皇族
sen.e: Imperial family
Imperial family
Imperial family

sen.j: - 親王諸王より臣位に列せられた者。
sen.e: Subjects who rank under Imperial Prince and Princess, and Shoo (princes without imperial proclamation)
sen.cmt: 文頭にハイフンを入れると表記がパソコン上で変化してしまうためハイフンは省略しました。文になっていないので最後にピリオドを入れてありません。
sen.e: Subjects who rank under the Imperial Prince and Princess, and Shoo (Princes without imperial proclamation)
sen.cmt: Imperial Princehe→the Imperial Princeとしました。
sen.e: Subjects who rank under the Imperial Prince and Princess, and Shoo (Princes without imperial proclamation)

sen.j: このような内規はあったが、実際に臣籍降下によって公爵を与えられた例はない。
sen.e: Though this bylaw existed, there were no examples of conferring the title of duke due to the demotion from an Imperial family member to a subject.
Though this bylaw existed, there were no examples of conferring the title of Duke due to a member of the Imperial family being demoted to a mere subject.
Though this bylaw existed, there were no examples of conferring the title of Duke due to a member of the Imperial family being demoted to a mere subject.

sen.j: 公家
sen.e: Kuge (court noble)
Kuge (court noble)
Kuge (court noble)

sen.j: - 旧摂家。
sen.e: Former Sekke (line of regents and advisers)
sen.cmt: 文頭にハイフンを入れると表記がパソコン上で変化してしまうためハイフンは省略しました。文になっていないので最後にピリオドを入れてありません。
sen.e: Former Sekke (line of regents and advisers)
Former Sekke (line of regents and advisers)

sen.j: 公家社会でも最高位に属するとされ、摂関に昇る資格を持っていた家柄である。
sen.e: The families were considered to rank the highest in court noble society and were qualified to be promoted to a regent to the emperor.
These families were considered to rank the highest in court noble society and were qualified to be promoted to act as a regent to the emperor.
sen.cmt: a regent→act as a regent としました。
sen.e: These families were considered to rank the highest in court noble society and were qualified to be promoted to act as a regent to the emperor.

sen.j: 近衛家・九条家・二条家・一条家・鷹司家の計5家。
sen.e: They are five families of Konoe, Kujo, Nijo, Ichijo, and Takatsukasa.
There are five such families: Konoe, Kujo, Nijo, Ichijo, and Takatsukasa.
There are five such families: Konoe, Kujo, Nijo, Ichijo, and Takatsukasa.

sen.j: 武家
sen.e: Buke (military authority)
Buke (military authority)
Buke (military authority)

sen.j: - 徳川氏。
sen.e: Tokugawa clan
sen.cmt: 文頭にハイフンを入れると表記がパソコン上で変化してしまうためハイフンは省略しました。文になっていないので最後にピリオドを入れてありません。
sen.e: Tokugawa clan
Tokugawa clan

sen.j: いわゆる旧将軍家であり、徳川家達家がこれにあたる。
sen.e: It is so-called former Shogun family and represents the family of Iesato TOKUGAWA.
It is the so-called former Shogun family and represents the family of Iesato TOKUGAWA.
sen.cmt: so-called former Shogun family の頭に the を補いました。
sen.e: It is the so-called former Shogun family and represents the family of Iesato TOKUGAWA.

sen.j: 1家のみ。
sen.e: Only one family exists.
Only one such family exists.
sen.cmt: one such family と such を補いました。
sen.e: Only one such family exists.

sen.j: 勲功者
sen.e: Those who rendered deed of valor
Those who rendered a deed of valor
sen.cmt: a deed と a を補いました。
sen.e: Those who rendered a deed of valor

sen.j: - 国家に偉勲ある者。
sen.e: Those who rendered distinguished service to the state
sen.cmt: 文頭にハイフンを入れると表記がパソコン上で変化してしまうためハイフンは省略しました。文になっていないので最後にピリオドを入れてありません。
sen.e: Those who rendered distinguished service to the state
Those who rendered distinguished service to the state

sen.j: 三種に大別できる。
sen.e: They are classified broadly into three groups.
They are classified broadly into three groups.
They are classified broadly into three groups.

sen.j: 一つは「偉勲」がなくとも華族たる資格を持っていた家のうち、功績が加味されて本来よりも高い爵位を与えられたグループである。
sen.e: One group consists of those who were qualified to be the peerage and received a higher title than they should have been given with their great service taken into account although they didn't make distinguished achievements.

One group consists of those who were qualified to be given a peerage, but received a higher title than they should have been given, due to their great service being taken into account, although they did not make distinguished achievements.
sen.cmt: to be the peerage and received を to be given a peerage, but received に訂正、with their great service を due to their great service に変更、didn't を did not に変更しました。
sen.e: One group consists of those who were qualified to be given a peerage, but received a higher title than they should have been given, due to their great service being taken into account, although they did not make distinguished achievements.

sen.j: 三条家（三条実美の功績）、岩倉家（岩倉具視の功績）、島津家（旧鹿児島藩家）、毛利家（旧長州藩家）の4家がこれにあたり、後年侯爵から陞爵した西園寺家（西園寺公望の功績）、徳大寺家（徳大寺実則の功績）、水戸徳川家（徳川篤敬の功績）の3家もこれに含めて考えられる。
sen.e: It includes four families of Sanjo (due to the achievement of Sanetomi SANJO), Iwakura (due to the achievement of Tomomi IWAKURA), Shimazu (of the former Kagoshima Domain) and Mori (of the former Choshu Domain), and in addition three more families of Saionji which was later promoted from a marquis (due to the achievement of Kinmochi SAIONJI), Tokudaiji (due to the achievement of Sanetsune TOKUDAIJI) and Mito-Tokugawa (due to the achievement of Atsuyoshi TOKUGAWA).

It includes four families of Sanjo (due to the achievement of Sanetomi SANJO), Iwakura (due to the achievement of Tomomi IWAKURA), Shimazu (of the former Kagoshima Domain) and Mori (of the former Choshu Domain), and in addition three more families of Saionji which were later promoted from the rank of Marquis (due to the achievement of Kinmochi SAIONJI), Tokudaiji (due to the achievement of Sanetsune TOKUDAIJI) and Mito-Tokugawa (due to the achievement of Atsuyoshi TOKUGAWA).
sen.cmt: families which was を families which were に、 a marquis を Marquis に訂正しました。
sen.e: It includes four families of Sanjo (due to the achievement of Sanetomi SANJO), Iwakura (due to the achievement of Tomomi IWAKURA), Shimazu (of the former Kagoshima Domain) and Mori (of the former Choshu Domain), and in addition three more families of Saionji which were later promoted from the rank of Marquis (due to the achievement of Kinmochi SAIONJI), Tokudaiji (due to the achievement of Sanetsune TOKUDAIJI) and Mito-Tokugawa (due to the achievement of Atsuyoshi TOKUGAWA).

sen.j: 次に本家がすでに公爵となっているにもかかわらず、その人物の特別な功績が認められて別に家を立てることをゆるされ、さらに公爵位を授けられたグループがある。
sen.e: Another group consists of those who were granted the title of duke after they were allowed to make a new family with their special achievement taken into account though their head families had had already the title.

Another group consists of those who were granted the title of Duke after they were allowed to make a new family with their special achievement taken into account, although their head families already had the title.
sen.cmt: duke を Duke としました。また、though 以下を次のように訂正しました 「, although their head families already had the title.」
sen.e: Another group consists of those who were granted the title of Duke after they were allowed to make a new family with their special achievement taken into account, although their head families already had the title.

sen.j: 具体的には、藩主ではなかったがその後見人として幕末の薩摩藩に大きな影響を与えた島津久光とその子孫、大政奉還後養子の徳川家達に家督を譲って隠棲した徳川慶喜とその子孫の2家である。
sen.e: They are specifically two families of Hisamitsu SHIMAZU, who was not the lord of the Shimazu domain but had a great influence on the domain at the end of Edo Period as a guardian, and his descendants, and Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA, who transfered the head of the family to an adopted child, Iesato TOKUGAWA, after Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor) and lived in seclusion, and his descendants.

There are specifically two such families: that of Hisamitsu SHIMAZU, who was not the Lord of the Shimazu domain but had a great influence on the domain at the end of Edo Period as a guardian, and his descendants, and that of Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA, who transferred the headship of the family to an adopted child, Iesato TOKUGAWA, and lived in seclusion after Taisei Hokan (the transfer of power back to the Emperor), and his descendants.
sen.cmt: two families を two such families: とし、that of で文を繋げました。また、Iesato TOKUGAWA 以下の文節の順を変更しました。
sen.e: There are specifically two such families: that of Hisamitsu SHIMAZU, who was not the Lord of the Shimazu domain but had a great influence on the domain at the end of Edo Period as a guardian, and his descendants, and that of Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA, who transferred the headship of the family to an adopted child, Iesato TOKUGAWA, and lived in seclusion after Taisei Hokan (the transfer of power back to the Emperor), and his descendants.

sen.j: 公家・諸侯等の華族に相当する家の出身でないにもかかわらず「偉勲」によって公爵を叙爵されたグループ。
sen.e: The other group consists of those who were granted the title of duke because of their great achievements although their families were not the peerage such as a court noble and a lord.
The other group consists of those who were granted the title of Duke because of their great achievements although their families were not peers such as court nobles or Lords.
sen.cmt: duke を Duke に変更、peerage を peers に変更、court noble および lord は複数表記、lords は Lords としました。
sen.e: The other group consists of those who were granted the title of Duke because of their great achievements although their families were not peers such as court nobles or Lords.

sen.j: いわゆる新華族である。
sen.e: They are so-called the new nobility.
They are the so-called new nobility.
sen.cmt: the so-called と the を補いました。
sen.e: They are the so-called new nobility.

sen.j: 伊藤博文、大山巌、山縣有朋、松方正義、桂太郎の5家がこれにあたり、西園寺家を含めると元老9人のうち6人が公爵を与えられていることになる。
sen.e: They are five families of Hirobumi ITO, Iwao OYAMA, Aritomo YAMAGATA, Masayoshi MATSUKATA and Taro KATSURA, and if Saionji family is included, six of nine Genro (elder statesmen) have received the title of duke.

There are five such families: Hirobumi ITO, Iwao OYAMA, Aritomo YAMAGATA, Masayoshi MATSUKATA and Taro KATSURA, and if the Saionji family is included, six of nine Genro (elder statesmen) have received the title of Duke.
sen.cmt: five families を five such families: とし、duke は Duke としました。
sen.e: There are five such families: Hirobumi ITO, Iwao OYAMA, Aritomo YAMAGATA, Masayoshi MATSUKATA and Taro KATSURA, and if the Saionji family is included, six of nine Genro (elder statesmen) have received the title of Duke.

sen.j: 特記のない限り、明治17年（1884年）7月7日に受爵。
sen.e: They received the title on July 7, 1884, if not otherwise specified.
They received the title on July 7, 1884, if not otherwise specified.
They received the title on July 7, 1884, if not otherwise specified.
